description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0b4a","text":"Human respiratory viruses (HRVs) are highly communicable viral pathogens that present varying degrees of illness in infected individuals. The advent of the COVID-19 pandemic demonstrated the utility of wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE) methods that bypassed traditional clinical testing for the virus. This method yielded powerful results, informing communities of potential outbreaks and allowing them to make informed decisions for the health and well-being of their community. The success of WBE can be employed to screen wastewater for other HRVs. Herein we establish a protocol that prepares viral RNA from extracted wastewater for use in a HRV target capture/enrichment sequencing assay. This protocol addresses the unique challenge of low viral load input for library preparation by randomly priming and non-specifically amplifying viral RNA. By then enriching only the sequences of interest in subsequent target capture/hybridization reactions, this method conserves sequencing resources and results in high-quality sequence information. Following downstream bioinformatics analyses, this sequence information can be used to help communities take appropriate action in mitigating the negative effects of HRVs. steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"86n4g","text":"Add 50μL of AMPure XP beads to 50μL SISPA product for a 1:1 purification ratio. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14s8v","text":"Incubate at RT for 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4obpj","text":"Spin down briefly and place on magnetic rack. Remove and discard supernatant once solution turns clear. Be sure not to disturb the bead pellets. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4efpm","text":"Wash beads with 200μL of freshly prepared 70% EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ca5d4","text":"Remove EtOH without disturbing beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dr1a0","text":"Repeat wash for a total of 2 washes. Remove EtOH without disturbing beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmo7r","text":"Remove samples from magnet and spin down briefly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eli95","text":"Remove residual EtOH. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2c940","text":"Let air dry briefly. Do not overdry the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"561qu","text":"Resuspend samples in 50μL of buffer EB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sequence Independent, Single-Primer Amplification [Moreno et al.; 1]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dnd6a","text":"Incubate samples at RT for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"edauf","text":"Transfer samples to magnetic rack. Transfer 48μL of eluted product to a new tube. Proceed to library prep protocol of your choice, or the samples may be stored at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8t7io","text":"Spin down to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube and place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"35ojj","text":"Purify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1aic","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated, room-temperature DNA purification beads until well mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3ad8","text":"Add 60μL of homogenized (0.8x) DNA purification beads to each ligation sample, and mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3bev0","text":"Incubate the samples for 5 minutes at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b06g0","text":"Place the samples on a magnetic rack for 1 minute or until the supernatant is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mep8","text":"Without disturbing the bead pellet, remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emlbt","text":"Wash the bead pellet by gently adding 200μL of freshly prepared 80% EtOH, being careful not to disturb the pellet. Incubate for 1 minute, then remove and discard the EtOH. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50n84","text":"Repeat the wash once, for a total of two washes, while keeping the samples on the magnetic rack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nvaj","text":"Carefully remove all remaining EtOH with a 10μL pipette, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kdg1","text":"Air dry the bead pellet on the magnetic rack for 5 minutes, or until the bead pellet is dry. Do not overdry the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6n3v","text":"Remove the plate from the magnetic rack and add 17μL buffer EB to each sample. Mix by pipetting until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6kuv1","text":"Incubate at RT for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8va9d","text":"Place the plate on a magnetic rack and let stand for 3 minutes, or until beads form a pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aklfr","text":"Transfer 15μL of the clear supernatant containing the ligated libraries to a clean 96-well plate, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agffe","text":"Spin down the sample plate and immediately transfer to the thermocycler. Proceed to purification when the program has completed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cc7r","text":"Spin sample down and immediately transfer to thermocycler. Start the program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s8lc","text":"Remove the samples from the thermocycler block when complete, and proceed to purification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f8d4","text":"Purify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3t7t8","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated DNA purification beads until mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5e5eh","text":"Add 50μL (1x) of homogenized DNA purification beads to each ligation sample post amplification. Mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"55lak","text":"Incubate the samples at RT for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"50rrm","text":"Place the samples on a magnetic rack for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2brfa","text":"The DNA purification beads form a pellet, leaving a clear supernatant. With plate still on the magnetic rack, remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejpj4","text":"Gently wash the bead pellet by adding 200μL of freshly prepared 80% EtOH, careful not to disturb the bead pellet. Incubate for 1 minute, then remove and discard the EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btgsu","text":"Repeat this wash once, for a total of two washes, while keeping the samples on the magnetic rack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81o11","text":"Carefully remove all remaining EtOH with a 10μL pipette, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ps55","text":"Air dry the pellet on the magnetic rack for 5-10 minutes, or until it is dry. Do not overdry the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61hb5","text":"Remove the samples from the magnetic plate and add 22μL of buffer EB to each sample. Mix by pipetting until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eqkic","text":"Incubate at RT for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32mff","text":"Place the plate back on the magnetic rack and let stand for 3 minutes, or until the beads form a pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5g2u","text":"Transfer 20μL of the clear supernatant containing the amplified indexed cDNA libraries to a clean 96-well plate, making sure not to disturb the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"82qo2","text":"Perform QC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1p11","text":"At this point, it is best to quantify and validate the size of fragments in the library. A Qubit dsDNA Broad Range Quantitation Assay or Agilent DNA 7500 is a valid method for QC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd2b1","text":"Add 25μL of Equinox Library Amp Mix (2x) to the cDNA libraries from the previous step and mix well by gentle pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25q5n","text":"Add 10μL of Twist UDI Primers from the provided 96-well plate to each of the cDNA libraries from the previous step, and mix well by gentle pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6dj3n","text":"Program a thermocycler with the following parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6580a","text":"98°C initialization for 45s, followed by 12 cycles of 98°C for 15, 60°C for 30s, and 72°C for 30s, 72°C  final extension for 1 minute, and a 4°C hold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aec9o","text":"Set the heated lid to 105°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"360kg","text":"PCR Amplify with Twist UDI Primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93u7q","text":"Incubate the ligation reaction at 20°C for 15 minutes in a thermocycler with the heated lid turned off, then move the samples to the bench top. While the thermocycler is running, prepare the reagents for step 7 (below). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h80e","text":"Add 2.5μL of molecular biology-grade H₂O and 20μL of Ligation Master Mix to each sample from step 5.1. Pipette a minimum of half the total volume up and down 10 times to ensure complete mixing. Seal the sample plate and spin down to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"123j7","text":"Invert the Ligation Master Mix a minimum of 10 times until homogenized and place on ice. Do not vortex the Ligation Master Mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8kpau","text":"Add 2.5μL of Twist Universal Adapters into each sample well containing the dA-tailed DNA fragments from the previous step. mix gently by pipetting, and keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rlgo","text":"Ligate Twist Universal Adapters and Purify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1d9a","text":"When the thermocycler has completed the program and sample block has returned to 4°C, remove the samples and place them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7i0hn","text":"Initiate the remaining steps of thermocycling program (refer to step 4.1). While the thermocycler is running, prepare the reagents for step 5 (below). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1gp1g","text":"Spin down and immediately transfer to pre-chilled thermocycler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdnvl","text":"Add 25μL enzymatic fragmentation mix to each 25μL sample well. Homogenize with moderate vortexing for 5s or by pipetting a minimum of half the total volume up and down 10 times, avoiding the formation of bubbles. Seal the plate and keep the reaction on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"326dr","text":"Prepare an enzymatic fragmentation mix in a tube on ice consisting of the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe0di","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kq7n","text":"Homogenize the master mix with moderate vortexing for 5s or pipetting a minimum of half the total volume up and down 10 times, avoiding the formation of bubbles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume per Reaction"],"colWidths":[100,100],"data":[["Molecular Biology Grade H₂O","15μL"],["Frag/AT Buffer","4μL"],["Frag/AT Enzymes","6μL"],["TOTAL","25μL"]],"guid":"05C0C5C06570475490CCD436ABD227A4","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Molecular Biology Grade H₂O","15μL"],["Frag/AT Buffer","4μL"],["Frag/AT Enzymes","6μL"],["TOTAL","25μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ue1c","text":"Invert Frag/AT Enzymes a minimum of 10 times to homogenize, or briefly vortex to ensure complete mixing. Spin down to collect all liquid in the bottom of the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12laq","text":"Vortex the Frag/AT Buffer for 5 seconds, and spin down to collect all liquid in the bottom of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48ucg","text":"Spin down briefly to ensure all of the solution is at the bottom of the tube, and then place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dak28","text":"Add 2.5μL of Twist Universal Adapters into each sample containing the dA-tailed DNA fragments from the above step. Mix gently by pipetting and keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"u8po","text":"Invert the Ligation Master Mix a minimum of 10 times until homogenized and place on ice. Do not vortex the Ligation Master Mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1n14a","text":"Add 2.5μL molecular biology-grade H₂O and 20μL Ligation Master Mix to each sample. Pipette a minimum of half the total volume up and down 10 times to ensure complete mixing. Seal the samples and spin down to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22ut","text":"Incubate the ligation reaction at 20°C for 15 minutes in a thermocycler with the heated lid off, then move the samples to the bench top and proceed to purify. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aeujj","text":"Purification of Product","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fga68","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated, RT DNA purification beads until well mixed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"u24l","text":"Add 60μL of homogenized (0.8x) DNA purification beads to each ligation sample from the previous step. Mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gdop","text":"Incubate the samples for 5 minutes at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctcl5","text":"Place the samples on a magnetic rack for 1 minute. The DNA beads form a pellet, leaving a clear supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d282c","text":"Without removing the samples from the magnetic rack, remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c9uaq","text":"Wash the bead pellet by gently adding 200μL of freshly prepared 80% EtOH, being careful not to disturb the pellet. Incubate for 1 minute, then remove and discard the EtOH. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6vi6","text":"Repeat this wash once, for a total of two washes, while keeping the samples on the magnetic rack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ehga","text":"Carefully remove all remaining EtOH with a 10μL pipette, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bipdu","text":"Air dry the bead pellet on the magnetic rack for 5 minutes or until the bead pellet is dry. Do not overdry the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"blnv5","text":"Remove the samples from the magnetic rack and add 17μL of buffer EB to each sample. Mix by pipetting until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b86hj","text":"Incubate at RT for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbl4j","text":"Place the samples back on a magnetic rack and let stand for 3 minutes or until beads form a pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fn33","text":"Transfer 15μL of the clear supernatant containing the ligated libraries to a clean 96-well plate, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. Proceed to index and amplify library. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b8te9","text":"PCR Amplify Using Twist UDI Primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b3qak","text":"Program a thermocycler set with the following parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9jvt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n0qe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"59dm0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78ve0","text":"Set the heated lid to 105°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Step","Temperature","Time","Number of Cycles"],"colWidths":[100,100,100,"213"],"data":[["Initialization","98°C","45 seconds","1"],["Denaturation","98°C","15 seconds","12"],["Annealing","60°C","30 seconds",""],["Extension","72°C","30 seconds",""],["Final Extension","72°C","1 minute","1"],["Hold","4°C","∞","--"]],"guid":"859B18CD48514797910DEE15B069CDE8","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{"D_2":[1,3]},"printData":[["Initialization","98°C","45 seconds","1"],["Denaturation","98°C","15 seconds","12"],["Annealing","60°C","30 seconds",""],["Extension","72°C","30 seconds",""],["Final Extension","72°C","1 minute","1"],["Hold","4°C","∞","--"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4avv5","text":"Add 10μL of Twist UDI Primers from the provided 96-well plate to each of the cDNA libraries from the previous step. Mix well by gentle pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7ikv","text":"Invert, do not vortex, Equinox Library Amp Mix (2x) 5 times prior to use. Add 25μL Equinox Library Amp Mix (2x) to the cDNA libraries and mix well by gentle pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"419ch","text":"Sin samples down and immediately transfer to thermocycler, and start the program. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v19k","text":"Remove the samples from the thermocycler block when the program is complete, and proceed to purification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ekgs1","text":"Aliquot and Dry Down Library","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cal7h","text":"Use the concentration of each amplified, indexed library to calculate the volume (in μL) of each library needed for hybridization. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sgg8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b9s7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf7qs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Number of Indexed
Samples per Pool","Amount of Each Indexed 
Library per Pool","Total Mass
per Pool"],"colWidths":["149","188","136"],"data":[["1","500 ng","500 ng"],["2","500 ng","1,000 ng"],["3","500 ng","1,500 ng"],["4","375 ng","1,500 ng"],["8","187.5 ng","1,500 ng"]],"guid":"4BDE8AF9E3AC4618B0A0F78A13A3E0FD","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["1","500 ng","500 ng"],["2","500 ng","1,000 ng"],["3","500 ng","1,500 ng"],["4","375 ng","1,500 ng"],["8","187.5 ng","1,500 ng"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8l2ev","text":"Transfer the calculated volumes from each amplified, indexed library to an indexed library pool reaction tube for each hybridization reaction being performed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":114,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amllc","text":"Spin down the library tubes to minimize the amount of bubbles present. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t6vn","text":"Dry the indexed library pools using a vacuum concentrator on a low or no heat setting. If not immediately proceeding to next step, store the dried indexed library pools at -20°C for 24 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16ktu","text":"Hybridize Capture Probes with Pools","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"640qk","text":"Heat the Hybridization Mx at 65°C in the heat block for 10 minutes, or until all precipitate is dissolved. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kdq5","text":"Prepare a probe solution for each pool in a PCR tube consisting of the following (scale up as needed):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqs2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s1vn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1j1de","text":"Mix by flicking tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bo0i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume per Pool"],"colWidths":["221","215"],"data":[["Hybridization Mix","20μL"],["Twist Respiratory Panel","4μL"],["Molecular Biology-Grade H₂O","4μL"],["TOTAL","28μL"]],"guid":"0AD03DC396BE480C96EBFF15FCEE74BC","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Hybridization Mix","20μL"],["Twist Respiratory Panel","4μL"],["Molecular Biology-Grade H₂O","4μL"],["TOTAL","28μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkp68","text":"Resuspend the dried, indexed library pools by preparing the reagents as follows (scale up as needed):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d98l9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpccj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume per Pool"],"colWidths":["223","303"],"data":[["Dried, Indexed Library Pool","---"],["Blocker Solution","5μL"],["Universal Blockers","7μL"],["TOTAL","12μL"]],"guid":"3A5AF987F0AF4CB29ACB0AB15CC751CD","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Dried, Indexed Library Pool","---"],["Blocker Solution","5μL"],["Universal Blockers","7μL"],["TOTAL","12μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e6bie","text":"Heat the probe solution to 95°C for 2 minutes in a thermocycler with the lid at 105°C, then immediately cool on ice for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iu6v","text":"While probe solution is cooling on ice, heat the tube containing the resuspended, indexed library pool at 95°C for 5 minutes in a thermocycler with the lid at 105°C, then equilibrate both the probe solution and resuspended, indexed library pool to RT on the bench top for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1q0hn","text":"Vortex and spin down the probe solution, then transfer the entire volume to the resuspended indexed library pool. Mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ih7l","text":"Spin down again to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lqe","text":"Incubate the hybridization reaction at 70°C for 16 hours in a thermocycler with the lid at 85°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"772ra","text":"Bind Hybridized Targets to Streptavidin Beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bora3","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated streptavidin binding beads until mixed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4gqm","text":"Add 100μL streptavidin binding beads to a 1.5mL micro centrifuge tube. Prepare one tube for each hybridization reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cebhn","text":"Add 200μL binding buffer to the tube(s) and mix by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gtbg","text":"Place the tube(s) on a magnetic rack for 1 minute, then remove and discard the clear supernatant. Make sure not to disturb the bead pellet. Remove the tube from the magnetic rack. Repeat the wash two more times for a total of three washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fan26","text":"After removing the clear supernatant from the third wash, add a final 200μL binding buffer and resuspend the beads by vortexing until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3c86","text":"Heat the resuspended beads at 68°C for at least 10 minutes before continuing to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5t7","text":"Once the hybridization is complete, open the thermocycler lid and directly transfer the volume of each hybridization reaction into a corresponding tube of preheated streptavidin binding beads from the above step. Mix by pipetting and flicking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnn33","text":"Incubate the tube(s) of the hybridization reaction with the streptavidin binding beads for 5 minutes on a heated mixer set to 68°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epfuj","text":"Remove the tube(s) containing the hybridization reaction with the streptavidin binding beads from the mixer and pulse-spin to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube(s). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e56dg","text":"Place the tube(s) on a magnetic rack for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdtf4","text":"Remove and discard the clear supernatant including the hybridization enhancer. Do not disturb the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jphf","text":"Remove the tube(s) from the magnetic stand and add 200μL 68°C standard wash buffer 1, and mix by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c48mj","text":"Incubate the tubes for 5 minutes at 68°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a4t1g","text":"Spin down to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube(s). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cggk","text":"Transfer the entire volume from the above step (about 200μL) into a new 1.5 mL micro centrifuge tube, one per hybridization reaction. Place the tube(s) on a magnetic rack for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9aq59","text":"Remove and discard the clear supernatant. Make sure not to disturb the bead pellet. Remove the tube(s) from the magnetic rack and add 200μL of 48°C wash buffer 2. Mix by pipetting, then pulse-spin to ensure all solution is at the bottom of the tube(s). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6u30d","text":"Incubate the tube(s) for 5 minutes at 48°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"91f81","text":"Place the tube(s) on a magnetic rack for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ccc8","text":"Remove and discard the clear supernatant. Make sure not to disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5i05v","text":"Repeat the wash two more times, for a total of three washes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83gt4","text":"After the final wash, use a 10μL pipette to remove all traces of supernatant. Proceed immediately to the next step, and do not allow the beads to dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mun6","text":"Remove the tube(s) from the magnetic rack and add 45μL molecular biology-grade H₂O. Mix by pipetting until homogenized, then incubate this solution, hereafter referred to as the streptavidin binding bead slurry, on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4m1q2","text":"Post-Capture PCR Amplify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ofud","text":"Program a thermocycler set with the following parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31vb5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac1qa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91iof","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nkra","text":"Set the heated lid to 105°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100],"data":[["Initialization","98°C","45 seconds","1"],["Denaturation","98°C","15 seconds","15"],["Annealing","60°C","30 seconds",""],["Extension","72°C","30 seconds",""],["Final Extension","72°C","1 minute","1"],["Hold","4°C","∞","--"]],"guid":"5ED3FA535CB746B48646D12F88F1463D","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{"D_2":[1,3]},"printData":[["Initialization","98°C","45 seconds","1"],["Denaturation","98°C","15 seconds","15"],["Annealing","60°C","30 seconds",""],["Extension","72°C","30 seconds",""],["Final Extension","72°C","1 minute","1"],["Hold","4°C","∞","--"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hk8q","text":"If the streptavidin binding bead slurry has settled, mix by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"il2g","text":"Transfer 22.5μL of the streptavidin binding bead slurry to a PCR tube. Keep on ice until ready to use in the next step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fold8","text":"Prepare a PCR mixture for each streptavidin binding bead aliquot consisting of the following (scale up as needed):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o0lm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f91h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"41alp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14bl4","text":"Mix by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Reagent","Volume per Reaction"],"colWidths":["226","211"],"data":[["Streptavidin Binding Bead Slurry","22.5μL"],["Amplification Primers, ILMN","2.5μL"],["Equinox Library Amp Mix (2x)","25μL"],["TOTAL","50μL"]],"guid":"BF140C088872430CB4F2761C4879315D","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Streptavidin Binding Bead Slurry","22.5μL"],["Amplification Primers, ILMN","2.5μL"],["Equinox Library Amp Mix (2x)","25μL"],["TOTAL","50μL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bu62k","text":"Spin down the tubes, and transfer them to the thermocycler. Start the thermocycling program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fdls3","text":"When the thermocycler program is complete, remove the tube(s) from the block and immediately proceed to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5dl5b","text":"Purification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64iru","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated DNA purification beads until well mixed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am7i2","text":"Add 90μL (1.8x) homogenized DNA purification beads to the tube(s) from the previous step. Mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8olde","text":"Incubate at RT for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76v2v","text":"Place the tubes on a magnetic rack for 1 minute or until the supernatant is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ghql","text":"The DNA purification beads form a pellet, leaving a clear supernatant. Without removing the plate or tubes from the magnetic rack, remove and discard the clear supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8845","text":"Wash the bead gently by adding 200μL of freshly prepared 80% EtOH, careful not to disturb the pellet. Incubate for 1 minute, then remove and discard the EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ibkb","text":"Repeat this wash, for a total of two washes while keeping the tube on the magnetic rack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfqn2","text":"Carefully remove all remaining EtOH using a 10μL pipette, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cddas","text":"Air Dry the bead pellet on the magnetic rack for 5 minutes, or until the bead pellet is dry. Do not overdry the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eih7d","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack and add 32μL buffer EB to each capture reaction. Mix by pipetting until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"70c1d","text":"Incubate at RT for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"749k1","text":"Place tubes on a magnetic rack and let stand for 3 minutes or until beads fully pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f4uj","text":"Transfer 30μL of the clear supernatant containing the enriched library to a clean PCR tube, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. If not proceeding to sequence immediately, the enriched library may be stored at -20°C for up to 24 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"95b57","text":"Perform QC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2j0kv","text":"Quantify and validate the concentration and/or fragment size range of each library using the Thermo Fisher Scientific Qubit dsDNA Broad Range Quantitation Assay or an Agilent DNA 7500 assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6mfc","text":"Sequencing on an Illumina NextSeq 2000 Platform","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2tek4","text":"Purification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2k1l0","text":"Perform QC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vd5t","text":"Vortex the pre-equilibrated DNA purification beads until mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crgob","text":"Add 50μL (1x) homogenized DNA purification beads to each ligation sample from the above step. Mix well by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58k1h","text":"Incubate the samples for 5 minutes at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40sk5","text":"Place the samples on a magnetic rack for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"207es","text":"The DNA purification beads form a pellet, leaving a clear supernatant. With plate still on the magnetic rack, remove and discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkr0o","text":"Gently wash the bead pellet by adding 200μL of freshly prepared 80% EtOH, careful not to disturb the bead pellet. Incubate for 1 minute, then remove and discard the EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mjff","text":"Repeat this wash for a total of two washes, while keeping the samples on the magnetic rack. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3uf86","text":"Carefully remove all remaining EtOH with a 10μL pipette, making sure not to disturb the bead pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ah7r","text":"Air dry the pellet on the magnetic rack for 5-10 minutes, or until it is dry. Do not overdry the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cls1","text":"Remove the samples from the magnetic rack and add 22μL of buffer EB to each sample. Mix by pipetting until homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fpaiq","text":"Incubate at RT for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37r4m","text":"Place the plate or tubes on a magnetic rack and let stand for 3 minutes or until the beads form a pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6v5n","text":"Transfer 20μL of the clear supernatant containing the amplified indexed libraries to a clean PCR tube, making sure not to disturb the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Total Nucleic Acids Library Preparation [2]
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"76e0c","text":"Quantify and validate the size range of each library using the Thermo Fisher Scientific Qubit dsDNA Broad Range Quantitation Assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2508v","text":"Subsequent sequencing preparation steps, including thawing of flow cell/reagent cartridge, diluting libraries to starting concentration, and setting up/loading a sequencing run into the NextSeq 2000 instrument can be found in Illumina's NextSeq 1000/2000 Product Documentation in the Sequencing Protocol section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
